reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The project will bring marginalized LGBTI women's communities together to work on the Protection of Minors Act and thereby strengthen their capacity for active citizenship. The project will also develop leadership skills for women from sexual gender and et hnic minorities who will be educated in civil activism.China is reforming its Minors Protection Law of the People's Republic of China. The bill is expected to come before the National Congress in 2020. The project aims to integrate the protection of LGBTI girls' rights into China's national legislation on the protection of minors. In addition the project aims to develop and increase the capacity of local communities to defend the rights of LGBTI women and girls in ethnic minority areas (Xinjiang Uighur Auto nomous Region and Guizhou Province).Positive reforms to China's law on the protection of minors which will extend legal protection for minors.The main beneficiaries are Chinese minors whose legal protection will be expanded as the result of the legal refor m. In addition marginalized women's communities who learn advocacy work and benefit from capacity building. The promoter Common Language is a community-based non-profit organization that supports LGBTI communities that are discriminated against because of their sexual orientation. Common Language was chosen for the project because of its goal-oriented approach and clear understanding on how to help disadvantaged people in the Chinese society. In addition the organisation's activities aim at attitudinal and structural change and allocate resources to measures that will pay off in multiples in the long term. In addition the project includes both concrete and structural change elements. The project is also designed to have long-term effects regardless of the ou tcome of the legislative process.

tag.narrative: Strengthening of the rights and status of women and girls is the main priority area in this activ ity
